documentation.text: @notice Farm admin can manage master Balance farms and fixed percent farms
@notice MasterBalance Address
@notice Address which is eligible to accept ownership of the MasterBalance. Set by the current owner.
@notice Array of MasterBalance pids that are active fixed percent farms
@notice mapping of MasterBalance pids to FixedPercentFarmInfo
@notice The percentages are divided by 10000

@notice Percentage of base pool allocation managed by MasterBalance internally
 @dev The BASE_PERCENTAGE needs to be considered in fixed percent farm allocation updates as it's allocation is based on a percentage

@notice Percentage available to additional fixed percent farms
@notice Total allocation percentage for fixed percent farms
@notice Max multiplier which is possible to be set on the MasterBalance

devdoc.author: DeFiFoFum (Balancetastic)
devdoc.details: This contract does NOT handle changing the dev address of the MasterBalance because that can only be done  by the dev address itself

acceptMasterBalanceOwnership().details: Transferring MasterBalance ownership away from this contract renders this contract useless.

addFixedPercentFarmAllocation(uint256,ui.details: Must be a new MasterBalance pid and below the max fixed percentage

params._pid: MasterBalance pid to create a fixed percentage farm for

addMasterBalanceFarms(uint256[],address[.details: syncs fixed percentage farms after update

params._allocPoints: Array of allocation points to set each address

batchUpdateMasterBalancePools(uint256[]).details: The MasterBalance massUpdatePools function uses a for loop which in the future  could reach the block gas limit making it incallable.

params.pids: Array of MasterBalance pids to update

returns._0: Number of active fixed percentage farms

getTotalAllocationPercent().details: Adds the total percent allocated to fixed percentage farms with the percentage allocated to the Balance pool.   The MasterBalance manages the Balance pool internally and we need to account for this when syncing fixed percentage farms.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setFixedPercentFarmAllocation(uint256,ui.details: If the farm allocation is 0, then the fixed farm will be disabled, but the allocation will be unchanged.

params._pid: MasterBalance pid linked to fixed percentage farm to update

setMasterBalanceFarms(uint256[],uint256[.details: syncs fixed percentage farms after update

params._allocPoints: Array of allocation points to set each pid
params._pids: Array of MasterBalance pool ids to update

params._pendingMasterBalanceOwner: Address to set as the pending owner of the MasterBalance.

params._tokens: Array of ERC20 addresses to sweep

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

BASE_PERCENTAGE.details: The BASE_PERCENTAGE needs to be considered in fixed percent farm allocation updates as it's allocation is based on a percentage

devdoc.title: Admin MasterBalance proxy contract used to add features to MasterBalance admin functions

batchUpdateMasterBalancePools(uint256[]).notice: Helper function to update MasterBalance pools in batches

farmAdmin().notice: Farm admin can manage master Balance farms and fixed percent farms

setMasterBalanceFarms(uint256[],uint256[.notice: Add a batch of farms to the MasterBalance contract

sweepTokens(address[],address).notice: An external function to sweep accidental ERC20 transfers to this contract.    Tokens are sent to owner

syncFixedPercentFarms().notice: Update pool allocations based on fixed percentage farm percentages

totalFixedPercentFarmPercentage().notice: Total allocation percentage for fixed percent farms

userdoc.notice: Admin functions are separated into onlyOwner and onlyFarmAdmin to separate concerns
